page.title: 05The Village Bridges
page.content: There are three bridges in the village of Kirkfieldbank.The first is known locally as The Roman Bridge , although it is not Roman, and was built across the River Mouse in 1649. This was a pack-horse bridge used by travellers going from Lanark to Hamilton.Where there was formerly a ferry for travellers from the east of the country going to the Ayrshire coast ,there is now Clydesholm Bridge built in 1699,across the River Clyde.This bridge is not suitable for modern traffic and has been replaced by a wider bridge a few yards further down the river.This was built in 1953. There is also a famous bridge,Cartland Bridge across a deep gorge of the River Mouse. This bridge was designed and built by Thomas Telford.
